result.execSummary:
The defendant Dominic D McCovery was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Duplicate Original Warrant returned from JCSD
Jefferson County DNA Proof of Submission
with element, JI's and criminal case settlement

[MK] case called at 11:35am. 
Defendant Dominic D McCovery in court with Attorney John V Rhiel.  ADA John Fryatt appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

The Court quashes the Warrant. 

On Motion of the State, the Court amends Count #2 to Misdemeanor Retail Theft- As a Party to a Crime.

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of "Guilty" entered on Count #2; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Count #2, the Court withholds sentence, and places Mr. McCovery on Probation for one year, with conditions:

--to undergo assessment, treatment, or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--no presence at the Johnson Creek Outlet Mall
--to attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge


Days credit for time already served:  3 days
The Court requires Mr. McCovery to report to the JCSO for DNA sample provision and any needed processing today.  
recess 11:43am.

Case called at 2:12 pm [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for MH/FSSC)
Attorney John Vernon Rhiel appeared in Court. Defendant Dominic D McCovery not in court. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Rhiel informs the Court that Mr. McCovery was surprised he had court today, was aware of Monday's date, but not todays. He indicated that he did want to accept offer from State, but had to work today at 3:00 pm and could not make it into court. Requests the Court stay warrant until Monday morning. Can confidently say matter will be plea and not trial.
Court reviews that Mr. McCovery received notice orally in court, in person and received notice for FSSC and JT together, expresses concerns regarding comments from Defendant as Mr. McCovery previously attempted to entered plea, but Judge O'Brien did not accept plea, due to issues with factual basis. 
Further discussions between Atty Rhiel/Court regarding factual basis - Atty Rhiel further discusses the Defendant's confusion re: party to a crime and court procedures
DA Happ requests warrant, presents basis
Court orders issuance of bench warrant - Body Only
Court cancels the trial and releases witnesses; Informs Counsel that if voluntary appearance is made, will fit him in for plea/sentencing
Recess: 2:24 pm
Motion to impeach the defendant with prior convictions/adjudications
Notice of intent to admit statements made by the defendant
With elements/JI's and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

Case called at 2:02 pm [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for STC)
[Reserve Judge Sarah O'Brien presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Dominic D McCovery in court with Attorney John Vernon Rhiel. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
On Motion of the State, the Court AMENDS Count #2 to Misdemeanor Retail Theft-Intentionally Take as Party to a Crime, contrary to 943.50(1m)(b), a Class A misdemeanor

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered; Due to answers given by Defendant during attempt to obtain factual basis, the Court indicates that It is reluctant to take a plea
off-record: 2:23 - 2:25 pm for Atty Rhiel to discuss matter with client
Atty Rhiel informs the Court that he is reluctant to proceed with plea/sentencing at this time
Court withdraws plea to amended charge; ADA Hall withdraws offer to amend charge to misdemeanor
Counsel request matter be set for trial
Court notes that State would like co-defendant's case tried at the same time, as cases have not been severed.

Court confirms address on file is accurate
Recess: 2:34 pm

NEXT: (1) Schedule FSSC 9/15/15 at 1:30 pm - Send notices (2) Schedule Jury Trial 9/21-22-15 at 8:30 am - Send notices
Status conference on July 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on June 17, 2015 at 09:20 am.

Cases 15CF103 & 15CF111 called together at 9:22 am [Clerk SH] 
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Nicholas R Burks in court with Attorney David Zarwell (15CF103). Defendant Dominic D McCovery in court with Attorney John Vernon Rhiel (15CF11). ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

BOTH CASES: 
Service of Information admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited.
Pleas of "not guilty" entered
Court reminds each Defendant that bond and conditions of bond remain in effect as case is pending.
ADA Hall expresses concerns about no contact provisions in both defendants bond, presents basis - Court reminds Defendants of No Contact Provisions
Recess: 9:29 am 

NEXT: 15CF103: (1) DA PTC scheduled for 6/17/15 at 8:40 am - Send notices (2) STC scheduled for 7/10/15 at 1:30 pm - Send notices
15CF111: (1) DA PTC scheduled for 6/17/15 at 9:20 am - Send notices (2) STC scheduled for 7/10/15 at 1:30 pm - Send notices
Request for substitution is timely and in proper form

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt:
Co-Defendants' cases #15CF103, #15CF111,#15CF113 called briefly at at 9:17, and then at 9:49am. 
Co-Defendant Nicholas Burks does not appear.  His counsel, Attorney David Zarwell, is in court.
Co-Defendant Dominic D. McCovery in court with Attorney John V. Rhiel
Co-Defendant Courtney Stewart in court with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek
ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.


As to #15CF103: 
--Mr. Burks has been in contact with court staff and Attorney Zarwell to say he is delayed in traveling here. The Court and parties have been awaiting his arrival.
--recess 9:59am, reconvene 10:09am. Mr. Burks now appears.
--Mr.  Burks waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.
--ADA Hall files the Information. 
--the Court will schedule Arraignment on a later date. 

As to #15CF111: 
--Mr. McCovery waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.
--ADA Hall files the Information. 
--Attorney Rhiel requests that Arraignment be scheduled on a later date.
--the Court modifies the Bond to add a clarification that : as long as any contact is through a third person, there may be contact for the purposes of arranging placement and visitations with the children, however this third-person contact is to involve no discussion of matters other than the logistics of the visitation, not about anything else, including that there is not to be any discussion about this case. 


As to #15CF113:
--On Motion of the State, the Court dismisses the case as to Co-Defendant Stewart. 
--The Court releases Ms. Stewart from the Bond and its conditions. 
ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance. 
recess 10:20am. 


NEXT:  (1) case dismissal as to Case #15CF133- Stewart  (2) schedule Arraignment on Co-Defendants #15CF103 and #15CF111 on 5/4/15 at 4:00pm.
Preliminary hearing on April 20, 2015 at 09:00 am.

[MK] case called at 1:28pm. 
Defendant Dominic D. McCovery appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek (PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 


Mr. McCovery verifies that the date of birth on the Criminal Complaint is correct; he corrects the numbers of the street address to be:  2567 N. 37th Street. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Counsel agree to the scheduling of the Preliminary Hearing on April 20th. 

The Court requires a $5,000  Signature Bond, with conditions:
--no contact with Nicholas Burks, Courtney Stewart
--no presence at the Johnson Creek Outlet Mall
--no acts or threats of violence
recess 1:31pm. 


NEXT:  Preliminary Hearing on 4/20/15 at 8:30am.
